definitions.example: Quality of life is usually determined by health, education, and income.

definitions.definition: A property or an attribute that differentiates a thing or person.
definitions.example: One of the qualities of pure iron is that it does not rust easily.

definitions.definition: High social position. (See also the quality.)
definitions.example: A peasant is not allowed to fall in love with a lady of quality.

definitions.definition: The degree to which a man-made object or system is free from bugs and flaws, as opposed to scope of functions or quantity of items.
In a two-phase liquid–vapor mixture, the ratio of the mass of vapor present to the total mass of the mixture.
The third step in OPQRST where the responder investigates what the NOI/MOI feels like.
definitions.example: To identify quality try asking, "what does it feel like?".

definitions.definition: A newspaper with relatively serious, high-quality content.
Being of good worth, well made, fit for purpose.
definitions.example: A quality system ensures products meet customer requirements.
